Name: Increasing penalties for owning or harboring a dangerous dog and requiring the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to report on dangerous dogs.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing penalties for owning or harboring a dangerous dog and requiring the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to report on dangerous dogs.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health

RTF:
{\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1033{\fonttbl{\f0\froman\fprq2\fcharset0 Times New Roman;}}
{\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green255\blue255;}
\viewkind4\uc1
\v0\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\sl480\slmult1\qj\ul Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1.  Subdivision a and b of section 17-350 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:\par
\'a717-350 \b Violations and penalties.\b0  \cf1 a. Any person who violates any provision of this subchapter or any of the regulations promulgated hereunder shall be guilty of a \ul class A\ulnone  misdemeanor punishable by a fine [or] \ul of\ulnone  not less than [five hundred] \ul one thousand\ulnone  nor more than [five thousand] \ul ten thousand\ulnone  dollars or by imprisonment for not more than one year, or both. \cf0\par
\cf1 b.  In addition to the penalties prescribed by subdivision a of this section, any person who violates any of the provisions of this subchapter or any rule or regulation promulgated hereunder shall be liable for a civil penalty of not less than [five hundred] \ul one thousand\ulnone  nor more than [five thousand] \ul ten thousand\ulnone  dollars.\par
\cf0\'a72.  Subchapter 6 of chapter 3 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 17-354.1 to read as follows:\par
\ul\'a717-354.1 \b Reporting requirement. \b0 Before January 1, 2012, and every year thereafter, the department shall provide the mayor and the city council with a report including, but not limited to, the following information:\par
a. the number of dangerous dog complaints received by the department during the previous calendar year;\par
b. the number of dangerous dog complaints that the department investigated during the previous calendar year;\par
c. an aggregation of the outcomes of the dangerous dog complaints investigated by the department during the previous calendar year;\par
d. the number of dogs that were classified as dangerous by the commissioner or a court of competent jurisdiction;\par
e. the number of dog bite complaints received by the department during the previous calendar year;\par
f. the number of dogs that were found to have rabies;\par
g. an aggregation of the outcomes of the dog bite complaints investigated by the department during the previous calendar year. \cf1\par
\cf0\ulnone  \'a73.  This local law shall take effect ninety days after enactment; provided, however, that the commissioner shall take such actions, including the promulgation of rules, as are necessary for timely implementation of this local law. \par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\sl480\slmult1\par
